panels.description: Counts for each result of issuing an outgoing sync request
panels.title: % Success for Issuing Outgoing Sync (Past Hour)

panels.description: Counts for each result of issuing an outgoing sync request

targets.expr: sum(increase(audius_cn_secondary_sync_from_primary_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", result=~"success.*"}[1h])) / (sum(increase(audius_cn_secondary_sync_from_primary_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", result=~"success.*"}[1h])) + sum(increase(audius_cn_secondary_sync_from_primary_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", result=~"failure.*"}[1h])))

panels.title: Percent Success for Processing Incoming Sync (Past Hour)
All Users Count by Content Node

panels.description:
CPU-second is one second of time on a CPU.
Process execution time has two measurements:
CPU time, or the amount of time that the CPU spent actively running the process; and
Wall time, or the amount of time that passes between you starting the process and the process ending.
panels.title: CPU Usage by Host (!!Assumes 16 cores!!)
NodeJS Heap Size Used by Host

targets.expr: sum by(host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_completed_total{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host"}[1h])) / (sum by(host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_failed_total{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host"}[1h])) + sum by(host) (rate(audius_cn_jobs_completed_total{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host"}[1h])))

panels.description: Number of times per hour that a node successfully issues an outgoing sync request vs number of times per hour a node successfully processes an incoming sync request (aggregated across all nodes). These should be very similar to indicate that outgoing syncs are processed correctly.
panels.title: Outgoing vs Incoming Sync Successes (Aggregate)

panels.description: Count of all issue_sync_request jobs by Host, excluding success_mode_disabled
panels.title: Outgoing Sync Counts by host

panels.description: Count of all incoming syncs by Host
panels.title: Incoming Sync Counts by host

panels.description: Number of times per hour that a node successfully issues an outgoing sync request vs number of times per hour a node successfully processes an incoming sync request (aggregated across all nodes). These should be very similar to indicate that outgoing syncs are processed correctly.

targets.expr: sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_issue_sync_request_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", result=~"success|success_secondary_caught_up|success_secondary_partially_caught_up|success_mode_disabled", host=~"$host"}[1h])) / sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_issue_sync_request_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host"}[1h]))

panels.title: Outgoing Sync Success % by Host

panels.description: Number of times per hour that a node successfully issues an outgoing sync request vs number of times per hour a node successfully processes an incoming sync request (aggregated across all nodes). These should be very similar to indicate that outgoing syncs are processed correctly.

targets.expr: sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_secondary_sync_from_primary_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", result=~"success|success_clocks_already_match", host=~"$host"}[1h])) / sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_secondary_sync_from_primary_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host"}[1h]))

panels.title: Incoming Sync Success %  by Host

panels.description: Time that a node spends processing a sync (i.e., a secondary syncing from a primary).

IssueUpdateReplicaSet Job Counts by Host and Result

panels.description:
Success rate of users updating their replica set 

---

An issue with this could mean something is wrong with the queues or a performance bottleneck

targets.expr: sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_state_machine_update_replica_set_queue_job_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", result=~"success.*"}[24h])) / (sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_state_machine_update_replica_set_queue_job_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", result=~"failure.+"}[24h])) + sum by(host) (increase(audius_cn_state_machine_update_replica_set_queue_job_duration_seconds_count{environment=~"$env", host=~"$host", result=~"success.*"}[24h])))
